title: Dave Millard
text:
Dave Millard (born 26 November 1979 in <a href="Fiji">Fiji</a>) is a Fijian-born former <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20sevens%20team">Scotland 7s</a> international <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> footballer. He played professionally for <a href="Glasgow%20Warriors">Glasgow Warriors</a>. His regular playing position was on the <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%2314.%20wing">wing</a>.
Born in Fiji but brought up in Scotland, Millard went to <a href="Merchiston%20Castle%20School">Merchiston Castle School</a> in Edinburgh. He went to Aberdeen University to study marine biology and zoology and played for <a href="Aberdeen%20GSFP%20RFC">Aberdeen GSFP</a>.
The wing came through the Scotland age-grade international setup. Millard played internationally for Scotland 7s in 2005. Millard played in the IRB AXA International Sevens tournament in Wellington, New Zealand but suffered a hamstring tear on his debut.
He also played club rugby in New Zealand.
He signed for the professional provincial side <a href="Glasgow%20Warriors">Glasgow Warriors</a> in <a href="2003%E2%80%9304%20Glasgow%20Warriors%20season">2003</a>. He played there for two seasons. He was released in <a href="2004%E2%80%9305%20Glasgow%20Warriors%20season">March 2005</a> and once again signed for <a href="Aberdeen%20GSFP%20RFC">Aberdeen GSFP</a>
For 2005-06 season, he joined <a href="Coventry%20R.F.C.">Coventry</a>.
He returned to Scotland in 2006 to join <a href="Glasgow%20Hawks%20RFC">Glasgow Hawks</a>.
Millard joined <a href="Falkirk%20RFC">Falkirk RFC</a> in 2009. He retired from playing in 2011.
